subclassFeature.name: The Wild Magic Wizard
entries: Despite your best efforts, magic just does not seem to work the same for you. A Wild Magic Wizard has an exceedingly tough time willing their control over their magics, and so it often has unpredictable, and unintended consequences.

subclassFeature.name: Cantrip Casting
entries: A Wild Magic Wizard does not learn, or control, their cantrips; they manifest them through the Wild Magic Wizard Cantrips Table. When casting a cantrip, you roll a d20, and the corresponding spell from the table is cast. Additionally, if the target chosen for the spell rolled on the table is beyond your normal movement, you teleport the remaining distance to be within range to cast it. You may only do this if you have physically seen the creature within the last minute.

subclassFeature.name: Wild Reactions
entries: Due to the influx of wild magic constantly surging through you, a Wild Magic Wizard is able to cast one reaction spell of 3rd level or lower at-will. It may be from any class, but it is cast at its base level, and can be switched only upon leveling up. You may only choose a spell that you are able to cast with the spell slots granted to you as a Wild Magic Wizard.

subclassFeature.name: Leveled Spell Casting
entries: When a Wild Magic Wizard casts a levelled spell, they roll on a table that consists of all of the spells in their spellbook at that level. This presents an interesting element of strategy for Wild Magic Wizards, as they may no longer want to learn every spell they possibly can.

items: A Wild Magic Wizard may have only one spellbook, but due to the unpredictable nature of the powerful magic within, it can be resummoned over the course of an hour with extreme mental effort.
A Wild Magic Wizard's spellbook must grow by at least 2 spells per level. However, one of these spells may be from any class spell list.

If the target chosen for the spell rolled on the table is beyond your normal movement, you teleport the remaining distance to be within range to cast it. You may only do this if you have physically seen the creature within the last minute.

entries: If you have remaining action economy, you may roll on the table again to try for a spell that you would mechanically be able to cast. (I.e. if you cast a cantrip with your action, you may roll on your leveled spell table for a spell that can be cast with a bonus action.) If you would not have the economy to cast the spell rolled, that economy is wasted.

subclassFeature.name: Wild Magic Surge
entries: By exerting an intense amount of effort, the Wild Magic Wizard can successfully tap into their magic, allowing them to surge and choose the spell they want to cast, without rolling. A spell cast this way expends one spell slot lower than the effect of the spell. This can also apply to upcasted spells, e.g. a 4th level magic missile burning a 3rd level slot. A 1st-level spell, however, must still burn a slot to cast. They can use this ability a number of times equal to their intelligence modifier (a minimum of once), and regain their uses on a long rest. When they cast a spell in this manner, they must roll on the Wizard Wild Magic Table.

entries.name: Pro Tip:
entries: This can also apply to upcasted spells, e.g. a 4th level magic missile burning a 3rd level slot. A 1st-level spell, however, must still burn a slot to cast.

subclassFeature.name: Improved Odds
entries: Starting at 6th level, the Wild Magic Wizard is able to gain some more control over their casting. When they would roll on a table to cast a levelled spell, they may roll twice and choose which spell to cast.

subclassFeature.name: Improved Cantrips Tables
entries: Starting at 10th level, the Wild Magic Wizard Cantrips Table splits into two equal tables, and can be arranged freely at each dawn. When casting a cantrip, they may roll two d10s on either table, and choose which spell is cast. Additionally, they may swap two cantrips off of either of the Wild Magic Wizard Cantrips Tables with any two cantrips of their choice, from any class. They may choose the same cantrip twice, and it can be a cantrip already present on either table.

subclassFeature.name: Improved Surge
entries: Starting at 14th level, when the Wild Magic Wizard would roll on the Wizard Wild Magic Table, they may roll twice and choose the outcome.
